Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend both "A Tale of Two Cities" and "Mansfield Park".
These two movies are both set in France during different historical periods.
The first movie, "A Tale of Two Cities", is based on Charles Dickens' novel published in 1859. The story takes place in London during the Napoleonic Wars. The main characters are lawyer Sydney Carton and French aristocrat Charles Darnay. In the end, both Sydney Carton and Charles Darnay die together at the end of the novel.

The second movie, "Mansfield Park", is based on Jane Austen's novel published in 1814. The story takes place in London during the Napoleonic Wars. The main characters are Mansfield Park owner, Mrs. Elizabeth Smith, and her two children, Fanny and Maria. In the end, both Mrs. Elizabeth Smith and her two children, Fanny and Maria, die together at the end of the novel.

Both movies have received critical acclaim for their compelling storylines, well-developed characters, and beautiful visual cinematography.
Additionally, both movies have been well-received by audiences from all over the world.
Overall, both "A Tale of Two Cities" and "Mansfield Park" are highly recommended movies that will provide you with an enjoyable and entertaining cinematic experience.

The movie follows a man named Aron Dufresne (portrayed by Arnold Schwarzenegger), who is sent to a company called Rekall,  where he undergoes a virtual reality simulation to relive his past memories and alter the course of his present life. After completing the simulation, Dufresne is left with a few memories of his past life that he can choose to incorporate into his present life. However, as Dufresne becomes increasingly obsessed with revisiting his past memories and altering the course of his present life, he begins to experience increasingly disturbing hallucinations of his deceased father, who appears to be warning him about the dangers of becoming too obsessed with revisiting his past memories and altering the course of his present life.
